sentence: Shares of Ingram Micro Inc.IM attained a new 52-week high of $36.66 on Mar 7, eventually closing at $36.50.
The closing share price represents an extraordinary one-year return of 51.3% and a year-to-date return of 20.1%.
Despite the lower-than-expected fourth-quarter 2015 results, investors remain optimistic about the company's growth prospect.
Some of the current optimism surrounding the shares may be attributed to the wide acceptance of the company's Cloud Marketplace which should boost revenues over the long run.
Cloud Marketplace is a global platform through which the company's channel partners and professionals can avail the required cloud services.
According to a study by IHS Inc., spending on cloud-based services should surge almost three times and reach $235 billion in 2017 from $78.2 billion in 2011.
We expect this to work in favor of distributors like Ingram Micro.
The Ingram Micro Cloud Marketplace has more than 200 cloud-based solutions from over 70 vendors, which include salesforce.com Inc. CRM , VMware Inc. VMW and AVG Technologies AVG .
Furthermore, the company's focus on the high-margin market and strategic acquisitions to increase market share are encouraging.
During the fourth quarter of 2015, the company acquired DocData, Grupo ACAO and Parallels Odin Service Automation to enhance its capabilities.
Moreover, Ingram Micro has been striking distribution deals with a number of original equipment manufacturers, thereby expanding its product portfolio.
Additionally, Ingram Micro's exposure in cloud computing products is expected to drive growth.
However, a tepid IT spending environment, persistent decline in PC shipments and a high debt burden remain the concerns.
